alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Muscatine; Scott (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued March 05 at 8:35PM CST until March 05 at 9:00PM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Quad Cities has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Southeastern Rock Island County in northwestern Illinois... Scott County in east central Iowa... Northeastern Muscatine County in east central Iowa... South central Clinton County in east central Iowa... * Until 900 PM CST. * At 835 PM CST, severe thunderstorms capable of producing a tornado were located along a line extending from near Walcott to Montpelier, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * These dangerous storms will be near... Milan and Donahue around 845 PM CST. Rock Island, Eldridge and Long Grove around 850 PM CST. Davenport, Moline and Riverdale around 855 PM CST. Other locations in the path of these tornadic storms include Bettendorf, East Moline, Silvis, Le Claire, Hampton, Port Byron, Rapids City, McCausland and Low Moor. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
